Toggle Menu

salt.modules.redis

Module to provide redis functionality to Salt

New in version 2014.7.0.

configuration

This module requires the redis python module and uses the following defaults which may be overridden in the minion configuration: 

redis.host: 'localhost'
redis.port: 6379
redis.db: 0
redis.password: None

bgrewriteaof

Syntax

salt.modules.redismod.bgrewriteaof(
								host=None,
								port=None,
								db=None,
								password=None
								)

Details

Asynchronously rewrite the append-only file

CLI Example:

salt '*' redis.bgrewriteaof

bgsave

Syntax

salt.modules.redismod.bgsave(
								host=None,
								port=None,
								db=None,
								password=None
								)

Details

Asynchronously save the dataset to disk

CLI Example:

salt '*' redis.bgsave

config_get

Syntax

salt.modules.redismod.config_get(
								pattern='*',
								host=None,
								port=None,
								db=None,
								password=None
								)

Details

Get redis server configuration values

CLI Example:

salt '*' redis.config_get
salt '*' redis.config_get port

config_set

Syntax

salt.modules.redismod.config_set(
								name,
								value,
								host=None,
								port=None,
								db=None,
								password=None
								)

Details

Set redis server configuration values

CLI Example:

salt '*' redis.config_set masterauth luv_kittens

dbsize

Syntax

salt.modules.redismod.dbsize(
								host=None,
								port=None,
								db=None,
								password=None
								)

Details

Return the number of keys in the selected database

CLI Example:

salt '*' redis.dbsize

delete

Syntax

salt.modules.redismod.delete(
								*keys,
								**connection_args
								)

Details

Deletes the keys from redis, returns number of keys deleted

CLI Example:

salt '*' redis.delete foo

exists

Syntax

salt.modules.redismod.exists(
								key,
								host=None,
								port=None,
								db=None,
								password=None
								)

Details

Return true if the key exists in redis

CLI Example:

salt '*' redis.exists foo

expire

Syntax

salt.modules.redismod.expire(
								key,
								seconds,
								host=None,
								port=None,
								db=None,
								password=None
								)

Details

Set a keys time to live in seconds

CLI Example:

salt '*' redis.expire foo 300

expireat

Syntax

salt.modules.redismod.expireat(
								key,
								timestamp,
								host=None,
								port=None,
								db=None,
								password=None
								)

Details

Set a keys expire at given UNIX time

CLI Example:

salt '*' redis.expireat foo 1400000000

flushall

Syntax

salt.modules.redismod.flushall(
								host=None,
								port=None,
								db=None,
								password=None
								)

Details

Remove all keys from all databases

CLI Example:

salt '*' redis.flushall

flushdb

Syntax

salt.modules.redismod.flushdb(
								host=None,
								port=None,
								db=None,
								password=None
								)

Details

Remove all keys from the selected database

CLI Example:

salt '*' redis.flushdb

get_key

Syntax

salt.modules.redismod.get_key(
								key,
								host=None,
								port=None,
								db=None,
								password=None
								)

Details

Get redis key value

CLI Example:

salt '*' redis.get_key foo

hget

Syntax

salt.modules.redismod.hget(
								key,
								field,
								host=None,
								port=None,
								db=None,
								password=None
								)

Details

Get specific field value from a redis hash, returns dict

CLI Example:

salt '*' redis.hget foo_hash bar_field

hgetall

Syntax

salt.modules.redismod.hgetall(
								key,
								host=None,
								port=None,
								db=None,
								password=None
								)

Details

Get all fields and values from a redis hash, returns dict

CLI Example:

salt '*' redis.hgetall foo_hash

								)

Details

Get information and statistics about the server

CLI Example:

salt '*' redis.info

Syntax

								key,
								host=None,
								port=None,
								db=None,

								)

Details

Get redis key type

CLI Example:

salt '*' redis.type foo

keys

Syntax

salt.modules.redismod.keys(
								pattern='*',
								host=None,
								port=None,
								db=None,
								password=None
								)

Details

Get redis keys, supports glob style patterns

CLI Example:

salt '*' redis.keys
salt '*' redis.keys test*

lastsave

Syntax

salt.modules.redismod.lastsave(
								host=None,
								port=None,
								db=None,
								password=None
								)

Details

Get the UNIX time in seconds of the last successful save to disk

CLI Example:

salt '*' redis.lastsave

llen

Syntax

salt.modules.redismod.llen(
								key,
								host=None,
								port=None,
								db=None,
								password=None
								)

Details

Get the length of a list in Redis

CLI Example:

salt '*' redis.llen foo_list

lrange

Syntax

salt.modules.redismod.lrange(
								key,
								start,
								stop,
								host=None,
								port=None,
								db=None,
								password=None
								)

Details

Get a range of values from a list in Redis

CLI Example:

salt '*' redis.lrange foo_list 0 10

ping

Syntax

salt.modules.redismod.ping(
								host=None,
								port=None,
								db=None,
								password=None
								)

Details

Ping the server, returns False on connection errors

CLI Example:

salt '*' redis.ping

Syntax

salt.modules.redismod.save(
								host=None,
								port=None,
								db=None,
								password=None
								)

Details

Synchronously save the dataset to disk

CLI Example:

salt '*' redis.save

set_key

Syntax

salt.modules.redismod.set_key(
								key,
								value,
								host=None,
								port=None,
								db=None,
								password=None
								)

Details

Set redis key value

CLI Example:

shutdown

Syntax

salt.modules.redismod.shutdown(
								host=None,
								port=None,
								db=None,
								password=None
								)

Details

Synchronously save the dataset to disk and then shut down the server

CLI Example:

salt '*' redis.shutdown

slaveof

Syntax

salt.modules.redismod.slaveof(
								master_host=None,
								master_port=None,
								host=None,
								port=None,
								db=None,
								password=None
								)

Details

Make the server a slave of another instance, or promote it as master

CLI Example:

# Become slave of redis-n01.example.com:6379
salt '*' redis.slaveof redis-n01.example.com 6379
salt '*' redis.slaveof redis-n01.example.com
# Become master
salt '*' redis.slaveof

smembers

Syntax

salt.modules.redismod.smembers(
								key,
								host=None,
								port=None,
								db=None,
								password=None
								)

Details

Get members in a Redis set

CLI Example:

salt '*' redis.smembers foo_set

time

Syntax

salt.modules.redismod.time(
								host=None,
								port=None,
								db=None,
								password=None
								)

Details

Return the current server UNIX time in seconds

CLI Example:

salt '*' redis.time

zcard

Syntax

salt.modules.redismod.zcard(
								key,
								host=None,
								port=None,
								db=None,
								password=None
								)

Details

Get the length of a sorted set in Redis

CLI Example:

salt '*' redis.zcard foo_sorted

zrange

Syntax

salt.modules.redismod.zrange(
								key,
								start,
								stop,
								host=None,
								port=None,
								db=None,
								password=None
								)

Details

Get a range of values from a sorted set in Redis by index

CLI Example:

salt '*' redis.zrange foo_sorted 0 10
